conversations.content: North Grastaea The Military Nation of Svenitla Dueli Mountains
This blizzard grows increasingly violent. How much further to our destination?
Should be just after this ridge, but let's get the lead out. If this storm gets any worse, we'll be trapped in a whiteout.
You won't make it out of here if you dawdle, so pick up the pace.
Y-yes, sir!
Tch. Where does a former imperial general get off telling us what to do?
He's been put in charge of this mission, so I suggest you stow the griping.
A few days earlier South Grastaea Chanzelia Royal Palace
While Satan was attacking Grams, the demon Jaldabaoth took the chance to invade the nation of Svenitla.
King Galkin thought his army stood little chance against the demon, so he abandoned his post and went into hiding.
He abandoned his people to save himself? Bah. What a pathetic excuse for a regent.
Galkin's grandnephew, Prince Litvinov took up command of the army and faced down the demon himself.
With the aid of the Halidom, they managed to dispel the demon, and Prince Litvinov soon seized the reins of power.
I am surprised Galkin did not try to slink back to the throne once the dust settled.
Prince Litvinov made certain that would not happen.
He had suffered under his granduncle's tyrannical rule, and had secretly been scheming revolution for some time.
As we speak, Litvinov is attempting to end all the wars Svenitla has started in the surrounding countries.
The skirmishes have been endless, so all sides are quite eager to complete a cease-fire agreement.
I think Euden will have an easier time of it in the north should that come to pass.
However, it is unlikely Galkin will sit back and permit his power to be usurped so.
You always were the clever one, Valyx. As a matter of fact, Galkin has already contacted criminal organizations and is gathering weapons and men as we speak.
Should that bloodthirsty cur regain power, he will no doubt begin waging wars again—wars that serve the interest of himself and the privileged classes alone.
With the threat of the Progenitor looming, we cannot afford such infighting amongst our possible allies.
Yet if Svenitla is dragged into a series of battles against Galkin's mercenaries, it will quickly become a problem of equal standing.
Indeed it will. Thankfully, your darling sister has a plan...
Galkin will not expect Alberia to enter this fray, which is why I am leading a secret force in hopes of resolving the situation quickly and quietly.
And while I appreciate you guiding us, I am surprised that you are allowing foreign soldiers to operate in your lands with such impunity.
Prince Litvinov is similar to his late father in his flexible thinking. This is why he summoned me back even after I abandoned my homeland.
More importantly, that mountain hut is our destination. Our informant will provide us with further information and hopefully a bowl of warm soup.
One bowl of soup for the freezing man. It's hot, so let me...blow on it.
That, er, will not be necessary, Malora. I must admit, when I heard Chelle had secured us a skilled spy, I never expected it might be you.
I am merely delighted to be together with you again, my dear general.
Spare the flattery and tempt me with your information instead.
Tch! You're still such a stick in the mud. But if you insist...
Galkin's mercenaries are using the coal mine ahead of us as a base. Also, they're armed with magical weapons purchased on the black market.
Tell us more of this mine.
It's quite difficult to navigate, but I managed to procure a sketch of the layout.
That's impressive work.
It IS, isn't it? Oh, and in other news, those goons have been scaring nearby villages into supplying them with food.
Hearing that, I posed as a villager in order to get nice and cozy with the soldiers— and my, but they had EVER so much they wanted to tell me.
The fact they would reveal their secrets so easily says much about the manner of enemy we face.
Well then, Malora? How do they procure this food of theirs?
They have the villagers load up a cart and then haul it off—and the next pickup is scheduled for three days from now.
We can't attack them head-on with a unit of this size or we'll be slaughtered.
Instead, we'll hide in the cart and infiltrate their base.
Once inside, we'll suppress them as quickly as we can and end this before it can start. Understood?
Yes, sir!
I'm surprised a big, strong warrior like you would rely on the element of surprise.
A skilled warrior fights with mind as well as blade. I have been entrusted with these soldiers' lives, and will not lose a single one if I can help it.
Say, where are you going?
With the storm died down, I was thinking to take in the fresh air.
Look, I know this is a weird time to ask, but what was this Valyx guy doing in Alberia in the first place?
I know he's the prince's brother and all, but he was a general for the Empire before, right?
I heard he was brought in to help strengthen their defenses, but who knows if that's true or not?
They've got a new emperor over there who ain't so heavy-handed on the foreign- affairs front. Maybe he just came crying 'cause they don't need soldiers anymore?
Well, either way, I don't much care for some former imperial general lording it over us like he owns the place.
I thought I told you to stow the griping.
I know, I know. But the imperial army burned my hometown to the ground. Don't you guys have your own reasons to hate them?
I hate them for destroying my home just as you do. But Valyx wasn't directly responsible, and on top of that, the Empire isn't what it once was.
I feel conflicted when I remember the children who died at their hands, and yet it would be wrong to cling to such hatred forever.
And even though they tried to execute me, I'm willing to let bygones be. If you don't let go of the past, it will destroy you.
Stepped out to allow your underlings to air their grievances, eh? Quite considerate of you to let 'em say their piece.
It is understandable that they'd feel that way. As their leader, it is my job to give them the opportunity to vent their bile.
I hear your companions were slain by the imperial army as well. As their former general, I offer my apologies. You may take your anger out on me if you wish it.
I took plenty of imperial lives myself, so let's just call it even.
But I still have questions about you.
It should have been obvious that your homeland had been corrupted, so why did you remain after Alberia became the Dyrenell Empire?
When war breaks out, civilians are roped into it whether they wish to be or not. I could not risk the people of my land suffering because I abandoned it.
But once New Alberia emerged, you could have allied with them and taken out the emperor that way, no?
It was my duty to look after my soldiers and countrymen. Had I abandoned them, I would be no different than the former king of your own land.
So it was ultimately always about protecting your own countrymen, then? Hmm. That makes sense.
But your words will likely ring hollow to those who lost all to the imperial army, no matter if they see the logic in it or not.
I care not if they understand my choices. All that matters is our working together to fulfill a mutual goal.
I suppose you're right.
I think everyone involved in this particular mission will likely accept that line of reasoning, but are YOU okay with it?
Eavesdropping, is it? I cannot claim to approve of such behavior.
I AM a spy, darling. Also, rule number one for getting the man you want is to gather every bit of information you can on him.
Remember when we last saw each other? I said I could have you within my grasp no matter how brusque you are—which is precisely why I decided to look into you.
Including everything you did as a general of the imperial army.
You weren't JUST trying to protect the empire—you wanted to protect everyone who lived in South Grastaea.
If you feel too awkward to admit it, I can tell them for you and spare you from their harsh words and thoughts.
...My actions do not change the suffering they endured at the hands of the imperials.
Any excuses would merely add fuel to the fire, so I would ask you keep whatever information you sussed out to yourself.
Ever the people person, aren't you? Oh, but this can't be good for you...
I know you care about the people more than anyone...
Three days later Svenitlan Territory Sosulka Village
We've come for your food, maggots— and you better have it waiting!
It's all loaded up on the cart and ready to go, handsome.
Well, if it ain't Malora. Ya always make things simple for us, darlin'—and it helps that yer easy on the eyes! Bwa ha ha!
Ya know, I'm gonna be a pretty big cheese once King Galkin's back in charge, and I'd  be happy to shower ya with all the riches what we squeeze outta these low-lifes.
Ooo, that sounds wonderful! (...In your dreams, creep-o.)
Oh, and ya better get all yer friends to start butterin' us up, or else they might wind up stretchin' on the end of a rope like all the other traitors! Bwaaaa ha ha ha!
We could hear them from inside the cart. These people are truly abhorrent.
I am loath to even name them soldiers.
We cannot allow such tyranny to go unchecked. We must take action and... Shhh! The cart is moving.
Susha Mine Former King Galkin's Hideout
That does it for everyone in this area.
He defeated all of those enemies in no time at all...
Good thing he's on our side.
We'll split up and overpower the enemy. Crush any foe who crosses your path!
We must not permit Galkin to escape, so keep a close eye out for him. And lastly...
R-run, General Valyx... You need not meet your end this day...
Lastly, I would see you all come through this alive. Now move out and stay alert.
Didn't expect that from a dude who used to be a general in the imperial army...
(I still don't understand him. Was preventing the country from being further divided really Valyx's only reason for staying in the Empire?)
HAAAAH!
(According to Malora's sketch, they're using this area as a command center.)
Hold, dog!
EEEK!
Your appearance matches the information we received from Malora. You're a high- ranking official who worked closely with the former king.
Speak, and do it quickly. Where is Galkin?
I have no idea where His Majesty is! I don't know anything, I swear!
And yet you can't seem to help yourself from staring at that bookshelf.
Gya!
Enjoy your nap, friend.
As I suspected, the shelf hides a secret passage. This isn't on the sketch, so...
(Jewels? Art? Gold? This is clearly a vault for the former king's fortune.)
I never thought any would dare step foot inside my sacred domain.
Galkin, I presume.
Indeed I am! And you must be the fourth scion of Alberia, General Valyx.
So you know of me.
I do. In truth, I was planning to invade Alberia before my little...incident, so I sent a spy to learn all they could about your delightful country.
I'm so envious of you Alberian royalty. Fertile lands, boundless resources, AND powerful dragonblood in your veins? Why, you're blessed beyond measure!
Just the thought of having such things under my control makes me giddy as a schoolboy.
Which is why you have been waging war on surrounding nations for all this time. Your greed truly knows no bounds.
You would turn against all a ruler stands for despite knowing full well how it will bring suffering to your people!
My country is my possession, and my people mere tools to be used as I see fit. They all exist to satisfy me—their king!
From my perspective, YOU are the strange one. Royalty serving as a general in order to shield some peasants? What madness!
A country is a home to its people, and it is the duty of those who rule over it to safeguard those lives.
Enough. It is clear you and I will never see eye to eye on this or any other issue.
Ah, but I did not come to understand you. I came to stop you.
Well, I can't have you doing that, now can I? Thankfully, I brought a little bargaining chip to ensure I can reclaim my power and reap all the rewards of royal life.
*cough* *cough* M-my body is...heavy... What have you done?!
Why, I've deployed a magical implement called a Brume! It's a lovely little device that emits a colorless, odorless mist.
Seeing as I've already taken the antitoxin, I will be fine. But alas, I fear the mana in your own body is starting to break down, which will lead to your inevitable demise.
Nnngh...!
Oh, please! Don't try to stand! It's just embarrassing for both of us. However, if you're willing to make an arrangement, I might be able to help you.
And what...is that...?
After I've regained my throne, I plan to take Alberia and claim the power of the dragonblood for my own.
If you swear fealty to me now and agree to assist in the invasion, I will gladly give you the antitoxin.
You abandoned that country once before, yes? It shouldn't be that difficult for you to do so again.
You know nothing of me!
Do not mistake me for a coward who might betray his country to save his own neck!
You can still move? Oh, how delightful! The dragonblood DOES run strong in you!
Ah, but what of your underlings?
What?!
Huh, what's this room? It's not on the map... *cough* *hack*
M-my body's so heavy...and I feel like my chest is on fire!
No! You should not have come here!
(...Damnation! Galkin escaped while I was focused on the soldiers!)
(He must have taken a secondary route out of the vault. I'm sure we could find it if we looked, but...)
*cough* *hack* *wheeze*
...This place is full of magic mist. Getting fresh air has to be our priority.
I know you are in pain, but stay strong and fight until we reach the exit.
I...I can't go on... Just leave me here...
I do not give you permission to die, soldier! Now move!
Th-the mine is starting to collapse!
(Galkin must have devised a way to destroy his own base...)
(We'll never make it back to the exit at the pace we're going now.)
All of you, stay close! I will shapeshift and serve as your shield!
ROOOOOAR!
Several days after the raid on Galkin's lair Svenitla Royal Palace
Galkin has escaped. Stupid as he was, he clearly foresaw this possibility, and has likely hidden his remaining forces in some other location.
We'll need to take extra care moving forward. Now then, how are the injured Alberian soldiers?
The two who breathed the mist are now undergoing treatment and expected to live. As for General Valyx...
Svenitla Royal Palace Medical Facility
How fares General Valyx today?
Still unconscious. That incident in the mine pushed him to the very edge.
Even after breathing in that mist, he still shapeshifted and was buried alive to protect the people under his command. He simply pushed himself too far.
He and Euden both are willing to push themselves to the brink in the service of others.
However different they may be, they remain brothers.
But that just makes Valyx's actions all the more strange. What possible reason did he have for staying with the Empire?
...Valyx told me not to say more than I needed to.
But I think you have a right to know why he stayed—and also what he did.
Follow me, all of you! This day, we ensure the evildoers face their final judgment!
These events occurred in the days after the Kingdom of Alberia became the Dyrenell Empire.
My troops and I were returning to the capital after a long excursion when we encountered a force who called themselves soldiers of the Dyrenell Empire.
We subdued them and stopped their attack on a village. I was stunned to see they were led by an Alberian general who I knew quite well.
You swore fealty to Alberia, General! Why do you now raid villages under the banner of the Dyrenell Empire?!
You've been away for a long time, old friend. The Kingdom of Alberia IS the Dyrenell Empire now!
We raided that village under orders from your father, Emperor Aurelius. This was an official military action.
My FATHER ordered this? Impossible!
If you doubt me, arrest me and bring me back to the capital. You'll quickly see the truth of my words then.
All was as he said: The Kingdom of Alberia had transformed into the Dyrenell Empire.
The general was set free, and I was accused of interfering with an official military operation. But when I voiced protestations to my father...
Speak to me, Valyx.
I understand that you wish to strengthen our national power by taking over new regions and gaining control of the whole of South Grastaea.
But I cannot sanction the way we are doing so through military means rather than continued negotiations.
Do you really expect self-governed cities and villages would cede control to us? No, my son—if we are to do this thing, force is the quickest path available to us.
And you will permit innocent civilians' suffering to see that goal achieved?
Furthermore, our imperial soldiers are ransacking the villages they occupy.  We're no better than common bandits!
As emperor, it is my duty to provide them with spoils of war, so I gave permission for such behavior in order to raise morale.
What have you done?!
I have also given them the authority to do anything it takes to carry out their mission, no matter how inhumane.
Now motivated by greed and sadism, our soldiers have demonstrated great enthusiasm for their jobs.
You always strove to create a country in which all of its people could live in peace.
I was once proud to call you my father— the man exalted as the Sage King— yet I do not know you anymore.
You are proving quite the nuisance, Valyx. I suppose I'll just have to convert you into a puppet like I did the other generals...
Hrk?! Wh-what power is this?!
Hmm... He's resisting. Is this because of the dragonblood, or does he do so through sheer tyranny of will?
Still, your pathetic little brother Emile was easily swayed by granting him a sense of superiority. Perhaps something can be done with you...
Emile may be a fool at times, but my father would never ridicule him...
Who are you?! And what do you intend to accomplish by assuming the guise of my father?!
You would point your sword at me? Well then, what will you do if I am indeed  not your father?
I will cut you down where you stand and set Alberia back on a righteous path.
As I thought. Yet the soldiers of this land have gladly given in to their base natures, and that cannot so easily be erased.
Should you kill me now, they will use your actions to justify further insurgence.
A battle for the throne will erupt— one that will be long and bloody.
The entirety of South Grastaea will run red with the blood of innocents.
No!
Even were that not the case, killing me will accomplish nothing—for this vessel belongs to your father in the end.
If it falls, I will simply find another host. Perhaps your older brother? Your sister? Maybe even one of the younger ones.
Regardless, your little rebellion would not lessen the number of deaths, and would more likely increase it.
Guards, I believe my son requires a bit of time to think on his current situation. Permit him to do so in the dungeon.

I had time enough to think in my cell, and realized the thing in my father's form was right: If I led a rebellion against him, it would quickly erupt into an all-out war that would divide our nation and cost the lives of uncountable civilians.
Sacrifices must be made to enact great change, but one must consider exactly WHAT they are willing to sacrifice.
After long deliberation, I requested an audience with the thing in my father's body.
Then that is the solution you've come to?
Yes. I will protect this country as a general and follow your orders.
But in exchange, I require full control of the internal workings of the military, for I intend to put an end to all pillaging and other unethical actions.
You may do as you please, so long as it does not interfere with my will.
Though royalty you may be, your position will be no more lofted than any other general of your rank.
The ultimate commander of the military will still be me, the emperor. In addition, I will not rescind my permission to pillage and engage in inhumane warfare.
Thus, your influence over them will have no weight, which makes it unlikely any of them will follow your will.
Even still, I will see it done. It is my duty as royalty.
So THAT'S the reason Valyx stayed with the Empire...
Valyx declared the military would stop all instances of looting and theft, and also forbade the soldiers from attacking indiscriminately or without reason.
The other soldiers and generals quickly came to despise him, and soon he was a pariah to all but his own troops.
But because he was royalty, many of them begrudgingly followed his orders.
Had Valyx had not been keeping an eye on them from the inside, the casualties brought on by the imperial army would have been much, much worse.
Now it all makes sense.
So you were listening?
Though he mourned the state of his country, he could not abandon it and join Euden so easily.
He had to stop the Empire's rampage from the inside, and so sacrificed himself for the greater good.
Now that I think on it, he may have already had hope for Euden from the very first time they fought...
What do you intend this gathering of yours to become in the end?
If you think yourself worthy still, follow me to the forest's heart!
Victory is yours, my brother. This day, you have gained your crown.
...Hope that Euden could change the Empire in his stead.
I thought I told you not to say more than was necessary.
Valyx! You're awake!
But she DID need to say this; we needed to know that your actions were all taken with the lives of your people in mind.
Any who harbor ill feelings toward you would see you in a brand new light if this were to become public knowledge.
Yet I failed to rein in the entire military, and they still undertook countless atrocities—not the least of which were those which befell all of you.
There are many I could not save due to my own powerlessness. That is a fact.
But let us turn to other matters: I doubt the Svenitlan army is here just to pay a visit. Did something happen to the former king?
Um, y-yes... It seems Galkin has taken his countrymen hostage and begun, um... making demands to the government.
So, um, Galkin has barricaded himself in an abandoned village in the mountains and begun...making demands to the new government.
He says he wants power restored to him, and if his demands are not met, he'll use his Brume to...cover the area in mist.
If he releases the mist up there, the mountain currents will carry it across the entire nation.
He's essentially using the people of Svenitla as hostages.
He's willing to kill EVERYONE in Svenitla?! Is he out of his damn mind?!
To think a man sworn to protect his people might turn his weapons against them...
Naturally, the government has no intention of complying with these demands.
However, the village they've set as their base is surrounded by steep mountains, and the only way in or out is by a single road that connects to town.
That road is easily defended. No matter the numbers we throw at them, they'll see us coming and have the advantage.
So is there nothing we can do?
(We need another way—one that doesn't involve the mountains or the road...)
I may have an idea.
Veter An Abandoned Village in Svenitla
Hey, you took your antitoxin, yeah?
'Course I did! 'Cause if this deal goes south, we're all set to use that Brume right away. ...Huh? Wait, what the hell's that?
May lightning rend you asunder.
...Wait. You want to attack from the SKY?!
It is the last thing they will expect. I will shapeshift and attack the village from above.
B-but the former king controls dangerous fiends as well as soldiers! It's too much for one person to take on alone!
I am fully aware of the danger, but this is the only way to stop his mad scheme.
But Valyx...
And even if the plan were to fail, I would be the only loss.
IT'S THE ENEMY! GAAAAH!
(My foes have split into three groups.)
(One has come to face me, one is rushing to the church, and the last is fortifying their defenses in the main square.)
(The Brume is useless for their purposes indoors, so those going to the church are likely doing so in order to guard Galkin. Which means...)
The enemy is heading for the square! He's after the Brume!
AAAAUHH!
There it is. Now to destroy it and... Fie!
This fiend is powerful indeed... Gah!
(I must still be weak from the wounds I sustained in the mine; I don't think I'll be able to hold this form much longer. I'll need to take another approach...)
What's this light?! A distraction?!
Nnngh...
The enemy's down! Get him!
I'm delighted to see you prostrate yourself before me once more, Valyx.
If he's here, they ain't got no intention of meeting our demands. Want me to deploy the Brume, Yer Majesty?
Fool! Why would we do that when we now have an Alberian prince for a hostage?
If we play our cards right, those pretenders who sit upon my throne will have no choice but to give us everything we want.
My people are a valuable tax base, after all, so I'd prefer not to slaughter them wholesale if I don't have to.
So you really do just see them as commodities to be used for your own  benefit... You are a disgusting excuse for royalty, fallen or no!
Yet I am this country's rightful king! The blood running through my veins serves as proof of this.
It is your blood lineage that makes you worthy of being a king in Alberia as well, is it not?
No. There are three traits of royalty. The first is that you must be a person born of a true and rightful bloodline.
But dragonblood is a power meant to protect the people, and merely inheriting it does not make one a true regent.
They must be strong of body and heart to utilize this power—this is the second trait. And finally, they must have the faith of the people to hold the country together.
Well, thank you for enlightening me. Yet can you really, truly claim to possess ALL of those qualities?
Of course, you have the blood of royalty running through your veins, and your coming here alone proves the mettle of your body and heart...
But the faith of the people? I think not! Why, they'd have to be mad to follow one who served as a general for the heinous Dyrenell Empire!
I once believed that none would follow me as I am now, and it would only be natural for them not to accept me.
But I am not alone.
And even if the plan were to fail, I would be the only loss.
You are SUCH an idiot sometimes!
I'm...sorry?
If you think we're just going to let you waltz out of here just because YOU'LL be the only loss, you're denser than the handle of your own axe!
In a perilous situation like this, we must accompany you.
You were forced to bear the burden of the imperial army's actions alone.
But you are now a general of Alberia. And as we are serving under you, you must trust us to have your back.
I do not know what to say...
A country can't function without trust between a ruler and their people.
Your job isn't just to protect us—it's to also believe in us and count on us when the chips are down.
I never thought the day would come when YOU would tell me how a ruler should be.
Still, how will the rest of you infiltrate the village?
If you're going to shapeshift and come at them from the skies, I have an idea...
We're nearing the drop-off point. Is your parachute ready?
Ready and able. I'll touch down just outside the village and await your signal.
...Even if you weren't directly responsible, I still find myself unable to forgive you for the deaths of my subordinates.
And once this operation is over, I'm going to punch you as hard as I can in the face. So don't you dare die before then.
I shall prepare my cheek for its inevitable bruising and pray for your safe return.
...There are more of you here?!
Victor wasn't the only one who grounded nearby—and as I did battle with the fiend in the square, I gave them the signal. They must be arriving right about...now.
K-King Galkin! It's a disaster!
The signal went off here in the square, which means...
Here! It's the Brume!
Let us put an end to it. Haaaah!
That takes care of the guards on the road!
Now the Svenitlan army can march in.
You have my thanks for your cooperation. Now to put an end to the former king.
We've finished encircling the village, Commander. Should we initiate an all-out attack?
Show the enemy a hell deeper than any demon has yet known—and may the hell you show our former ruler be deeper yet.
Noelle, relay a message to the enemies who have barricaded themselves in. If they surrender now, we will grant them all a full pardon.
Y-yes, ma'am!
Our soldiers are surrenderin' before they've even put up a fight!
The Brume's gone and a whole army's attackin'. There's no way we're winning this. I'm outta here!
W-wait for meeeee!
You utter imbeciles! You'll pay for throwing your king to the wolves!
It is only natural that soldiers who fight merely to sate their own greed would abandon you at the slightest misstep.
Perhaps if you had not abandoned your people when the demon attacked, this might have turned out differently.
No... It doesn't end here... I'm a king, damn you! A king! A KIIIIIING!
Such desperate flailing embarrasses us both. Do not humiliate yourself further.
Gyaaaaaah!
Now go ruminate in a cell about what it TRULY takes to be a ruler.
South Grastaea Chanzelia
General Valyx!
You are the men who were exposed to the mist! How fare you both?
We managed to pull through, thanks to you.
We heard from the other soldiers that you stayed in the imperial army to try and keep them from doing too much damage.
We were saying such awful things about you earlier. I can't apologize enough!
No need. You were merely unaware.
All my troops survived the operation, and that is reward enough for me.
King Litvinov sends his thanks to you.
Also, it seems the Svenitlan soldiers who served at your side have become quite taken with you as well.
Ah, that reminds me: Victor promised to punch me in the face after the mission, but I left before he had the chance. I suppose I will have to pay another visit.
You've really outdone yourself, Valyx. Thanks to you, it will be much easier for us to operate in the north.
I merely did what was asked of me. However...
I heard you were the one who told Malora of my time in the Empire. Why did you give her this information?
To clear my adorable little brother's name, of course.
This is not the moment for jokes.
Ugh. You really should remove that stick on occasion, dear brother. Yes, well, I suppose there is another reason. ...Here. Take a look for yourself.
This is a registry of names—and if I'm not mistaken, they are renowned soldiers of all races and nationalities.
The Progenitor's influence has caused fiends and dragons alike to rampage, which makes this a global threat.
Soldiers of Alberia and the former empire alone will not be enough to fend it off.
Thus, I decided to form a combined army between countries throughout the land.
And these are the names of soldiers who have agreed to participate?
Just so. Svenitla is there, of course, but also Hinomoto, the Sandreach, and even Aquaphos.
And the general who will be leading them all...is you.
Me?
The only sticking point with that plan was your past work as a general for the former Dyrenell Empire.
Thus, I needed to tell people what you were really doing in order to dispel any remaining animosity.
I chose Malora to spread the word because she had once done battle with you and knows your true character quite well.
Her hard work has led to quite the change of opinion on your behalf.
I am honored you hold me in such high regard, but are you certain you want me  taking on such a vital role?
Oh, don't be so modest. You're the only one who can do it, and you know it.
Did you know your older brothers and I have always been envious of you?
You inherited more of Father's courage than any of us.
